title: REVIEW --- Play: News Quiz
text:
B. Diamond

C. Platinum

D. Molybdenum

---

2. Brazil has more people of a certain kind than any other country, but they're about to become a minority. Who are they?

A. Portuguese speakers

B. Roman Catholics

C. Gun owners

D. Citizens of Iberian descent

---

3. Consumer prices rose last year by 7%, the most since when?

A. 1946

B. 1973

C. 1982

D. 2007

---

4. Citigroup will exit the consumer banking business -- in what country?

A. Mexico

B. Japan

C. China

D. The U.S.

---

5. British Prime Minister Boris Johnson apologized -- for what transgression?

A. Coiffure neglect

B. An extramarital liaison

C. Failing to pay taxes on income from his last two books

D. Attending a cocktail party during Covid lockdown

---

6. Nigeria said it will reinstate a social media platform it banned last year. Which one is that?

A. Twitter

B. TikTok

C. Instagram

D. Facebook

---

7. Sacre bleu! French dressing has been deregulated. What happened?

A. Capital requirements for salads were eliminated.

B. The FDA abandoned its official French dressing definition.

C. President Macron abolished rules on school attire.

D. U.S. tariffs on beret imports were cut to zero.

---

8. Georgia defeated Alabama for the College Football Championship. What's the winners' nickname?

A. Panthers

B. Yellow Jackets

C. Bulldogs

D. Crimson Tide

---

9. According to Procter & Gamble, what do 67% of Americans do when it's time to wash dishes by hand?

A. Find something else to do

B. Don rubber gloves

C. Fill the sink with soapy water

D. Apply dish soap to each item as they wash it

---

ANSWERS

1. C

2. B

3. C

4. A

5. D

6. A

7. B

8. C

9. D
